zendesk.suas

Class AsyncMiddleware

  • java.lang.Object
    • zendesk.suas.AsyncMiddleware
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Middleware

    public class AsyncMiddleware
extends java.lang.Object
implements Middleware
    Async Middleware - Actions carrying an AsyncAction get intercepted by this Middleware and not dispatched to the reducer. Instead the AsyncMiddleware executes AsyncAction.execute(Dispatcher, GetState)

    How to use this middleware:

    1. Create an AsyncAction
    2. In AsyncAction.execute(Dispatcher, GetState) perform any operation. AsyncAction.execute(Dispatcher, GetState) isn't executed on a background thread.
    3. When the result is ready use the Dispatcher to dispatch a new Action
    4. Create Action by calling create(AsyncAction)

     AsyncAction asyncAction = new AsyncAction(){
   public void execute(final Dispatcher dispatcher, GetState getState) {
     Network network = new Network();
     network.load(new Callback() {
       public void onResult(Object data) {
         dispatcher.dispatch(new Action<>("network_success", data));
       }
     });
   }
 };

 Action action = AsyncMiddleware.create(asyncAction);
 store.dispatch(action);
    For convenience there's forBlockingAction(AsyncAction). An Action created with that function will be be executed on a background thread. For doing so it uses Android's AsyncTask.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static Action create(AsyncAction asyncAction)
        Create an Action. The action created through this method will never reach a Reducer. Instead the passed in AsyncAction will be executed.

        Important: AsyncAction.execute(Dispatcher, GetState) will be run on the main thread.

        Parameters:
        asyncAction - an async action
        Returns:
        an action

      • forBlockingAction

        public static Action forBlockingAction(AsyncAction asyncAction)
        Create an Action. The action created through this method will never reach a Reducer. Instead the passed in AsyncAction will be executed.

        Important: AsyncAction.execute(Dispatcher, GetState) will be run on a background thread. For doing so AsyncMiddleware uses Android's AsyncTask.
        If you wish more control over the threading behavior consider using create(AsyncAction) with your own threading strategy.

        Parameters:
        asyncAction - an async action
        Returns:
        an action

      • onAction

        public void onAction(@NonNull
                     Action<?> action,
                     @NonNull
                     GetState state,
                     @NonNull
                     Dispatcher dispatcher,
                     @NonNull
                     Continuation continuation)
        Description copied from interface: Middleware
        Called before an Action gets passed to the Reducers.

        Examples: Log state changes: 

         void onAction(...) {
    State oldState = state.getState();
    continuation.next(action);
    State newState = state.getState();

    System.out.println(stateDiff(oldState, newState));
 }
        Consume an Action and dispatch it on a background thread: 
         void onAction(...) {
    if(action.getData() instanceof AsyncAction) {
        // consume action
        backgroundTask.start(action.getData, dispatcher);
    } else {
        continuation.next(action);
    }
 }
        Specified by:
        onAction in interface Middleware
        Parameters:
        action - a dispatched action
        state - access to the current state
        dispatcher - access to the dispatcher for dispatching a new action
        continuation - callback for passing the action to the next middleware
